summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to a recipient (M—) regarding a revised letter concerning Jeffrey Epstein, specifically incorporating a change about naming counsel. It appears to be internal DOJ correspondence during the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email who has revised a letter concerning Epstein, incorporating a change regarding the naming of counsel.

connections.description: Colleagues or professional contacts within the U.S. Attorney's office communicating about a revised legal document (Epstein letter).

events.title: Revision of Epstein Letter
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sends a revised letter concerning Jeffrey Epstein, incorporating a change regarding the naming of counsel.

keyFacts: Internal DOJ correspondence regarding the Epstein case occurred on November 13, 2007.
A revised legal letter concerning Jeffrey Epstein was prepared, with a specific change made regarding the naming of counsel.
The communication shows ongoing prosecutorial activity and coordination within the U.S. Attorney's office during the Epstein investigation.
